txt.en: 'Alas, nothing happened when you poured the draught upon the gardens? Hoom! That is disappointing. It means that the gardens are truly lost.\n\n'But wait, you say that you saw a flower among the desolation? That is something....'
'Did you discover any sign which might help me?'
An Ent in Search of Entwives
Nothing happens when you pour the Ent-draught
'Hoom-hom, make certain to pour the Ent-draught throughout the gardens.'
This would be a good place to pour the Ent-draught
'Hoom-hom, make certain to pour the Ent-draught throughout the gardens.'
Nothing happens when you pour the Ent-draught
The gardens of the Entwives lie within the cliffs to the south-east of Gnarlstump.\n\nGnarlstump gave you an Ent-draught and asked you to pour it upon the ruined gardens of the Entwives.
'Hoom-hom, make certain to pour the Ent-draught throughout the gardens.'

This looks like a good place to pour the Ent-draught
Gnarlstump, an Ent of Fangorn, has come to the desolation that was once the gardens of the Entwives, seeking signs which might point at the direction of their long-ago departure from the Brown Lands.

'Hello there, Little One. My old eyes are not what they once were, hoom, but in these barren places, even I can see that you are not a creature to be feared. You may call me Norndos, or perhaps Gnarlstump, if it is easier for you. Ta-rum! I will not tell you my right name, and I do not expect yours.

'I have come to this place because here were once the gardens of the Entwives. The land was ruined long ago, hom, and the gardens were lost. The Entwives went forth from this place, hoom-hom, never to be seen again. I desire to find the Entwives, if any still remain, and hope to find some sign of their passing.

'Would you aid me? Take this Ent-draught and pour it upon the desolation of the gardens...if anything grows there, ta-run, it may help to identify who the gardens belonged to.'
